name: Tacos al Pastor
description: A popular Mexican street food featuring marinated pork cooked on a vertical spit, served on small tortillas with pineapple, onions, and cilantro.
steps: Marinate thinly sliced pork in a blend of chilies, achiote paste, garlic, and pineapple juice overnight.
Cook the pork on a vertical spit or in a very hot skillet until charred and tender.
Chop the cooked pork into small pieces.
Warm small corn tortillas and fill with pork.
Top with diced pineapple, chopped onions, and fresh cilantro.
Serve with a squeeze of lime and salsa.
tips: Ensure the marinade is well blended for even flavor.
If you don't have a vertical spit, a grill or skillet works fine for cooking the meat.
Keep tortillas warm wrapped in a cloth until ready to serve.
